title: Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI)
description: Quantifies disease activity in Crohn's disease patients using clinical symptoms and laboratory findings over a 7-day period

parameters.name: liquid_stools_week
parameters.description: Total number of liquid or loose stools over the past 7 days (patient diary)

parameters.name: abdominal_pain_score
parameters.description: Average daily abdominal pain rating over the past 7 days (0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe)

parameters.name: general_wellbeing_score
parameters.description: Average daily general well-being rating over the past 7 days (0=generally well, 1=slightly under par, 2=poor, 3=very poor, 4=terrible)

parameters.name: arthritis_arthralgias
parameters.description: Presence of arthritis or arthralgias (joint pain/inflammation)

parameters.name: iritis_uveitis
parameters.description: Presence of iritis or uveitis (eye inflammation)

parameters.name: anal_fissure_fistula
parameters.description: Presence of anal fissure, fistula, or abscess

parameters.name: antidiarrheal_use
parameters.description: Use of antidiarrheal medications (loperamide, diphenoxylate) during the past 7 days

parameters.name: abdominal_mass
parameters.description: Presence of abdominal mass on physical examination (0=none, 2=questionable, 5=definite)

parameters.name: patient_sex
parameters.description: Patient biological sex (for expected hematocrit calculation)

parameters.name: ideal_weight
parameters.description: Ideal body weight in kilograms (calculated or estimated)

result.name: cdai_score
result.description: Total CDAI score ranging from 0 to approximately 600 points

ranges.interpretation: CDAI <150 indicates clinical remission. Patients in this range are typically rated as 'very well' by physicians. Continue current maintenance therapy and monitor regularly.
CDAI 150-219 indicates mild disease activity. Consider optimization of current therapy or step-up treatment. Monitor closely and reassess in 2-4 weeks.
CDAI 220-299 indicates moderate disease activity. Consider corticosteroids, immunomodulators, or biologic therapy. Reassess in 2-4 weeks.
CDAI 300-450 indicates severe disease activity. Consider hospitalization, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, or biologic therapy. Close monitoring required.
CDAI >450 indicates very severe disease activity. Consider hospitalization, intensive medical therapy, or surgical intervention. Immediate specialist consultation recommended.

references: Best WR, Becktel JM, Singleton JW, Kern F Jr. Development of a Crohn's disease activity index. National Cooperative Crohn's Disease Study. Gastroenterology. 1976;70(3):439-444.

Sandborn WJ, Feagan BG, Hanauer SB, et al. A review of activity indices and efficacy endpoints for clinical trials of medical therapy in adults with Crohn's disease. Gastroenterology. 2002;122(2):512-530.

Jørgensen LG, Fredholm L, Hyltoft Petersen P, et al. How accurate are clinical activity indices for scoring of disease activity in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)? Clin Chem Lab Med. 2005;43(4):403-411.
formula: CDAI = (Liquid stools × 2) + (Abdominal pain × 5) + (General well-being × 7) + (Extraintestinal complications × 20) + (Antidiarrheal use × 30) + (Abdominal mass × 10) + (Hematocrit deficit × 6) + (Weight deficit × 1)
notes: Requires 7-day patient diary for stool frequency, pain, and well-being scores
Developed in 1976 by the National Cooperative Crohn's Disease Study Group
Gold standard for assessing Crohn's disease activity in clinical trials
A decrease of ≥70 points is considered a significant response to treatment
A decrease of ≥100 points indicates a major clinical response
Does not include endoscopic findings or quality of life measures
Expected hematocrit: 47% for men, 42% for women
Weight deficit calculated as percentage below ideal weight
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment and other assessments
